Package main

Class PacmanGame

java.lang.Object
main.CoreEngine
main.PacmanGame
All Implemented Interfaces:
EngineComponent, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.util.EventListener
public class PacmanGame
extends CoreEngine
Base class for this pacman game; instantiates all core controllers, game engine, entity sprites and runs the main render loop. Singleton class, fetch running instance using PacmanGame.getGameInstance();
Author:
Harry Felton - 18032692

    The possible game states

      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • HORIZONTAL_GRID_COUNT

      public static final int HORIZONTAL_GRID_COUNT
      The count of the grids that make up the width of the game. Ideally, this should be an odd number to allow symmetrical designs and centered spawning points.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      The entry point of this game. Creates the singleton instance.
      Parameters:
      args - The arguments passed to the program

    • playScoreSoundEffect

      public void playScoreSoundEffect()
      Plays the sound effect that should play when a player pickups a point

    • initialiseEngine

      public void initialiseEngine()
      Initialise all the controllers for this instance
      Overrides:
      initialiseEngine in class CoreEngine

    • graphicsReady

      protected void graphicsReady()
      When the graphics are ready, this method initialises all the UI fragments and changes the game state to the MENU

    • update

      public void update​(double dt)
      Called on each update tick. Changes the state of the game to the next queued state. If the game is paused, the PauseFragment is activated. If the game state is currently GAME, and the game isn't paused, then the entities and effects are updated.
      Parameters:
      dt - The amount of time passed since the last tick

    • paintComponent

      public void paintComponent()
      Called when the game requests a repaint. If the graphics are ready, and the fragments aren't initialised, initialise them. Clear the game screen, and redraw the entities, effects and UI.

    • keyPressed

      public void keyPressed​(java.awt.event.KeyEvent event)
      Dispatches the key event to the registered entities, unless the key was 'ESCAPE', in which case the game is (un)paused.
      Specified by:
      keyPressed in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
      Overrides:
      keyPressed in class CoreEngine
      Parameters:
      event - The KeyEvent to be dispatched

    • togglePause

      public void togglePause()
      Toggles the pause state of this game instance, and refreshes the scene to reflect this change in pause

    • mousePressed

      public void mousePressed​(java.awt.event.MouseEvent event)
      Dispatches the MouseEvent to the UI controller
      Specified by:

      Overrides:
      mousePressed in class CoreEngine
      Parameters:
      event - The MouseEvent to be dispatched

    • changeGameState

      public void changeGameState​(PacmanGame.STATE s)
      Change the game state to the one provided. Activates the fragments that must be active for the selected state.
      Parameters:
      s - The new game-state

    • scheduleGameStateChange

      public void scheduleGameStateChange​(PacmanGame.STATE s)
      Schedule a game-state change
      Parameters:
      s - The next game state

    • playerDeath

      public void playerDeath​(Player player)
      Notifies this game instance that the player provided has died.
      Parameters:
      player - The losing player

    • levelComplete

      public void levelComplete()
      Player has collected all the points in the current level. Reset the entity controller, load the next map (if any), and re-initialise ghosts and PacmanEntity.

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer()
      Returns the players currently playing
      Returns:
      Return the list of Player instances

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Start the game by creating the Player instance, and initialising the EntityController with the player. Spawns the initial pickups, ghosts, and the player entity (Pacman).

    • quitGame

      public void quitGame()
      Quit the game

    • generateRandom

      public java.util.Random generateRandom()
      Create the random number generator
      Returns:
      Returns the random number generator, creating one if one doesn't already exist

    • generateRandomPoint

      public java.awt.Point generateRandomPoint()
      Generates a random point within the boundary of the game
      Returns:
      Returns the Point generated

    • getGameInstance

      public static PacmanGame getGameInstance()
      Fetches the SnakeGame singleton instance
      Returns:
      Returns the existing SnakeGame, or creates one if it doesn't exist yet.

    • getGameGraphics

      public java.awt.Graphics2D getGameGraphics()
      Fetch the game graphics from the underlying game engine
      Returns:
      Returns the Graphics2D instance

    • getSpriteController

      public SpriteController getSpriteController()
      Returns the sprite controller for entities to fetch their associated sprite frames.
      Returns:
      The SpriteController instance attached to this game.

    • getMapController

      public MapController getMapController()
      Returns the MapController to allow the games code to test for collisions, and to draw the maps from outside the main game loop.
      Returns:
      The MapController instance attached to this game.

    • getUIController

      public UIController getUIController()
      Fetch the UI controller from the game instance
      Returns:
      Returns the UIController

    • getCollisionController

      public CollisionController getCollisionController()
      Fetch the collision controller from the game instance
      Returns:
      Returns the CollisionController

    • getEntityController

      public EntityController getEntityController()
      Fetch the entity controller from the game instance
      Returns:
      Returns the EntityController

    • getEffectsController

      public EffectController getEffectsController()
      Fetch the effects controller from the game instance
      Returns:
      Returns the EffectsController

    • getScoreboard

      public Scoreboard getScoreboard()
      Fetch the scoreboard instance from this game instance
      Returns:
      Returns the Scoreboard instance
